channel.title: Changing model color

item.title: Changing model color
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:3, topic:551988”][quote author=Welliton_inc link=topic=670905.msg4486509#msg4486509 date=1434286377]
Not too familiar with the renamed ints, but it looks like the int you provided should work.
[/quote]

I was thinking i needed to maybe go thru a cache editor of some sort[/quote]

Cache editor? No no, that isn’t right. As long as all your changing is the modified color’s number then it really should work.

item.title: Changing model color
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

Alright so i done tried to change the model colors inside of itemDef.java 925 and 0 but nothing is happening how am i suppose to change the color of this partyhat so that it is black? :palm:

case 12006: itemDef.modelID = 2635; itemDef.name = "Black PartyHat"; itemDef.description = "A black partyhat" .getBytes();// examine. itemDef.modelZoom = 440; itemDef.modelRotationY = 76; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1850; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -3; itemDef.stackable = false; itemDef.membersObject = true; itemDef.anInt165 = 187; itemDef.anInt200 = 363; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; itemDef.originalModelColors = new int[1]; itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1]; itemDef.originalModelColors[0] = 926; itemDef.modifiedModelColors[0] = 0; break;

Read full topic
